Enumeration Type Documentation

enum SWI_ATSendOption

list of supported AT command sending options

Enumerator:
SWI_AT_CMD_OPT_1 

AT command with sending option single line.

SWI_AT_CMD_OPT_2 

AT command with sending option multi line.

SWI_AT_CMD_OPT_3 

AT command with sending option multi value.

enum SWI_OEMHookType

list of supported RIL_REQUEST_OEM_HOOK_STRINGS subcommand Note: the negative value subcommand(s) reserved for Sierra internal test purpose only

Enumerator:
SWI_AT_COMMAND_OPT 

Test support for AT cmd w/ sending option.

SWI_CURRENT_STATE 

invoke RIL currentState()

SWI_ON_SUPPORTS 

invoke RIL onSupports()

SWI_ON_CANCEL 

invoke RIL onCancel()

SWI_GET_VERSION 

invoke RIL getVersion()

SWI_CDMA_ACTIVATION 

CDMA Activation procedure.

SWI_DO_FACTORY_RESET 

Reset modem to factory defaults.

SWI_PRL_UPDATE 

Client-initiated PRL update request.

SWI_GET_SAR_STATE 

Client-initiated Get RF SAR status.

SWI_SET_SAR_STATE 

Client-initiated Set RF SAR status.

SWI_SET_SMS_WAKE 

Call SetSMSWake().

SWI_GET_ppDATAp 

Query #DATA#.

SWI_SET_ppDATAp 

Set #DATA#.

SWI_VALIDATE_SPC 

Validate SPC.

SWI_READ_SIM_PB 

Read the complete PB from SIM.

SWI_PRL_CANCEL 

Cancel the current OMADM session.

Function Documentation

void swicommon_requestOEMHookStrings ( void *  data,
size_t  datalen,
RIL_Token  t 
)

Common OEM Hookstrings handler function.

This function can respond to OEM Hookstring requests with subcommands identified in the case statement below. It is called by either of the two RIL-specific hookstring handler functions if the incoming subcommand doesn't match one of the RIL-specific ones.

Parameters:
[in] data pointer to the packet data
datalen packet data length
t RIL token
Returns:
None
Abort:
none
Note:
This command defined as a RIL test command. The idea is treating the string array sent from client side as a command structure data[0] - subcommand data[1] - parameter 1 of subcommand data[2] - parameter 2 of subcommand ... ...

The response packet will be like following responses[0] - subcommand responses[1] - raw string of subcommand response line 1 responses[2] - raw string of subcommand response line 2 ... ...
